name: Ambrosia Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Ambrosia last year our room was next to the standby generator and delivery area with no view except a wall, all that said it is a quality hotel. We decided to give it another go this year. We were a party of 8. Again the room we were given had no view no balcony, but fortunately the rest of our party had good rooms. I spoke to the manager and explained my disappointment on my second stay at his hotel , he promised a change of room, and good to his word he gave us a great room with balcony and sea view. The hotel overall is one of the best in Bitez.... Downside not the best for Food. Which didn't really matter as we liked eating out most of the time
reviews.title: Nice chance

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel the last week of August with 2 friends. We discovered that we had not gotten the sea view that we requested, we let this slide as we did get a pool view to the left of the hotel. However the complaints just grew after this.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room:
reviews.title: Not as good as I expected

reviews.text: On arriving at the room we discovered that the toilet did not work properly as the flush was broken. We also had trouble getting the air conditioning working as well as the safe deposit box. At first we attempted to ring reception by dialing 9 on the phone in the room as we had been instructed to by the Irish lady on reception when she was checking us. However, this did not work so less than a half an hour after arriving at the hotel we found ourselves back at reception.
reviews.title: Ambrosia hotel bitez Turkey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The male receptionist (very friendly and with good English) informed is that "technical services" would be sent to our room to help. Ten minutes later technical services arrived - took the front off the A/C to "fix" it (this remained off for the next day) there was not much improvement and most of the time it was cooler outside the hotel room than in. In order to help with the safe deposit box he slid the front compartment off (like a child's toy) and removed the batteries and stood there as we entered our safe deposit code. Then to the toilet. He proceeded to bang the flush button of the toilet around for 5-10 minutes and came out to inform us that the problem had been fixed. The problem with the toilet persisted for the whole week. What followed were a series of visits to the reception desk, once more on the same day, another fruitless visit from technical services, during which we were given a lesson on how to flush the toilet. (Push the flush side and then stop the flow of water almost immediately by pressing the top of the button inwards). This method worked for a little while, but by the next morning the toilet was not working again! Another trip to reception. Another visit from technical services. At one point we had three members of technical services crowded around the toilet. However, all of these visits brought only temporary fixes to the problem. We made yet another visit to the man at reception, who could not believe that the problem was persisting. This time he came with technical services to ensure that the problem would be fixed. As he supervised they took the cistern apart and removed a white piece which they informed us was the problem and would be replaced. The problem seemed to be solved, however that night we were back to square one. Water would constantly trickle into the toilet but there was no flush.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: Had a fantastic time at this hotel back in August.we have never been looked after so well any where else in the world.All that mattered to the staff was that you had a great time and we certainly did.Nothing was to much trouble, they would do anything for you.Entertainment was superb especially the Irish Night with Inchequin. The whole hotel had a great atmosphere and buzz about it,The Staff involved you and entertained you with their great sense of humour,Thank you to Bobby,Tahir,Darren,Richard Gere,Ferat,Genghis,Cowboy,Salem and the remainder of the staff.just a reminder Mr Gere you still owe us for the loan of our wife's during are stay LOL! another thank you goes to Joy the manager who was very approachable with any issues.The food was fantastic every individual requirement was catered for.A thoroughly fantastic fortnight was had and will definitely go back soon,Great value for money, Must try the Fish Bowl Cocktail but lookout for the Fish LOL!. ,
reviews.title: best holiday ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ambrosia is the same as it looks in the brochure. The rooms are very contemporary and very nicely decorated. The hotel is kept spotlessly clean by the really friendly and helpful cleaning team. Excellent variety of food in the outdoor restaurant, always tasty and well presented. The puddings are absolutely delicious. service in the restaurant is good and delivered by some very friendly waiters. Location is brilliant, right on the beach and the view from the hotels sun terrace is breath taking. All in all this is a very good hotel, the only thing that let's it down is the constant loud booming music playing from the enormous loud speakers in the bar. The music can be heard no matter where you sit, beach or hotel grounds which makes it hard to find a spot to relax.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: our group was a family of six , with ages ranging from 15 to 76 , the hotel suited each of us for many different reasons, yes , the food is not always what you would have at home, so stay at home! the breakfast and evening buffet offered a wide and varied menu (which all of our group found something we liked even a\ fussy vegetarian.) The staff worked hard day and night to ensure the guests had a good time and nothing was too much trouble for them , from the cleaner to the manager all the staff were polite and helpful. i would not hesitate in recommending the ambrosia to any one and will be returning one day. As this was our first trip to Turkey we were not sure what to expect , each one of us had a fantastic time and would just like to thank all of the staff at the ambrosia for one of the best holidays we have ever had.
reviews.title: something for everyone

reviews.text: Just arrived home today after a lovely week in bitez the hotel was lovely and very clean the rooms were cleaned and fresh towels daily the only let down was the evening buffet not to our taste but other guests seemed to enjoy it the day time manageress was very nice also the night manager abdull they were always on hand if you wanted to ask them anything and were always helpful we are planning to return but will just go bed and breakfast as there are plenty of good places outside the hotel to eat also entertainment in the hotel was good something different every night the ambrosia is one of the nicest hotels in bitez
reviews.title: Fab holiday

reviews.text: I have been to Bitez, Turkey many times before but this was my first stay in the Ambrosia. Where to begin....
reviews.title: NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were upgraded to a suite for our first 2 nights and struck a deal to stay in the suite for the remainder of our holiday.
reviews.title: perfect holiday

reviews.text: The hotel is very freindly, guests are a variety of nationalities.
reviews.title: disappointed

reviews.text: The staff are freindly and professional, especially Gill and Hassan on reception.
reviews.title: A wonderful holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would aggree with several reviews regarding the food. Breakfast is fine with a wide choice, dinner however is rather bland "school dinnerish". The buffet seating is canteen like. That said, if you want a cheap holiday, you will not be disappointed staying here half board.
reviews.title: Great Holiday - hope to return next year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The a-la-carte restaurant is very good, "Richard Gere" is a hoot.We had lunch here every day and a few evenings, and there are plenty of places to choose from further along the strip.
reviews.title: Great location & lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel in june 2012, booked a room with pool view but was given a room with a view of the bins this was sorted next day otherwise the rooms are spacious and clean, great varity in the buffet rest'nt. Located on the beach where there are free sun beds. Staff friendly and very laid back. Beautiful spa and a visit is a must giving great value for money.The only drawback would be the hotel allows patrons to put their towels on the sun beds around the pool from 6am onwards which don't give everyone a fair chance.
reviews.title: A place to chill

reviews.text: The hotel looked great on arrival but thats where it ends food was basic not a great choice. Cats roaming all over restaurant, dogs around the gardens, flies around the buffet area would not recommend
reviews.title: Dogs and cats

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed there as a couple and it our first holiday together and overall as our first trip it was a great experience. the hotel was clean most very friendly with staff to help you feel relaxed and there were no major issues. However, we arrived at 3 in the morning and wanted to get water but all stores were closed and therefore asked reception but it was so much more expensive than the supermarket we later found close to the hotel. My advice would be to buy your water elsewhere and store it in the mini fridge. There were a few minor issues especially at dinner (we had half board) where you had to pay for your drinks, which i found was inconvenient since it is so hot and we assumed we were paying for everything including food and drinks (drinks were free at breakfast but not dinner). it should have been complementary at the least. If we were to be picky we would have liked the food to be at least covered at the buffet as they provide an outdoor dining area which attracted flies most of the time. The beach is more pebbles than sand however unless you are picky the beach is very nice and close to the hotel with many restaurants and shops down the road. the staff are very sociable and friendly (most friendliest staff i have ever encountered) in particular this 'cowboy' guy who always had a smile and called us the best couple which was very nice to hear everyday and made sure we enjoyed our day and had everything we needed :) the maids always cleaned our room and this one maid in particular was always jolly and made the effort to fold our covers into heart and boat shapes which was a great touch to our room. the only problems with the room was that it was smaller than expected and we did not really have a balcony (which we felt was the only room that did not compared to the others) but its big enough for the smokers. also the bed had very little covers which was not even big enough to cover the whole bed therefore with the air-conditioner on you got a little bit chilly. there was a convenient free shuttle to Gumbet (nightlife area) which was great because we did not need to take a taxi. the hotel in general keep sure that their guests are happy and well and will help with anything you need as soon as they could. for example our safe was broken and was fixed within 10 minutes we informed reception. the entertainment at the hotel was different every night and was very enjoyable. to be honest after reading some negative comments about this hotel before hand we were not expecting much but then when we arrived it exceeded our expectations. we would definitely return and recommend this to anyone, especially couples. it was an amazing holiday for us.
reviews.title: pretty damn good holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the hotel looked very nice on arrival with its huge chandelier in reception it did not take us long to find just how poor the place was.
reviews.title: VERY POOR

reviews.text: For a 200+ room hotel to have only 16 sun beds around the pool was very disappointing and yes if you were not up at 6am you never got a sunbed by the pool
reviews.title: One of our best holidays so far!!

reviews.text: We have recently returned from a fantastic holiday at the Ambrosia Hotel, Bitez. The hotel is ideally located directly on the beach.....and Bitez itself..offers a very relaxing environment especially suited to families...as well as being in close proximity by cab or dolmush to Gumbet and Bodrum...
reviews.title: Wonderful Holiday...Great Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel offers great quality rooms..which were cleaned to a high standard daily. We opted for half board...which suited us as a family...although I would say that dinner could do with starting slightly earlier than 7.30. The food was of a high standad and variety...the catering staff and waiters were very friendly and always very helpful.
reviews.title: Absolutly fantastic !!
Great Holiday
reviews.text: The hotel has nightly entertainment from 9pm until 12am....we had a beach view room and our balcony was directly over the stage area...ideal if your children have an early night....you are still able to enjoy the entertainment from afar !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is lovely, although I would say a little on the small side for the size of the hotel....unfortunately there is still an early morning start to bag a sun bed around the pool....
reviews.title: Enjoy your holiday whilst you can

reviews.text: Overall, I would say that this hotel is highly recommended, the location, the rooms, the food, the staff, all excellent...a wonderful holiday had by our family...we would defiantly recommend to friends and family.
reviews.title: Excellant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Ambrosia is one of the most relaxed, friendly and professional places I have visited in Turkey. The hotel is amazing and always clean, with the staff working very hard to keep the hotel in this condition.
reviews.title: Amazing time and amazing place!

reviews.text: The swimming pool and beach area are immaculate and the waiter service offered is friendly and helpful. They are always prepared to cater for your every need.
reviews.title: Did return,,,,,,,,,Never again!!!
Not a 4 star hotel
reviews.text: The reception staff are helpful and cooperative and always prepared to help with any small question you and they make it very easy getting to get to know life in the Bodrum area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the hotel, the entertainment was 'entertaining' a different form put on every night and with a lot of variety to keep us fully occupied and busy! Two extremely helpful individuals were 'Cowboy' and 'Darren'. These two workers made our stay friendly, enjoyable and they would work beyond to ensure the stay was pleasant. A free shuttle service was given into Gumbet by the hotel, to which 'Cowboy' escorted us and made us feel welcome in an area we did not know. He ensured we were safe and enjoying our evening. The hotel also placed on a minibus to get us back from Gumbet....a service I find faultless!
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel are certainly first class at making sure their guests are happy! I would definitely stay again, and can't wait to come back!
reviews.title: i love it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from a 10 day break with my Partner at the Hotel Ambrosia. Prior to our arrival, we contacted the hotel requesting a quiet room with a sea view and were reassured that all rooms in the Ambrosia were quiet rooms. We arrived at 4am to discover we had a very run down room with a tiny bed (not even a double) that had lots of springs sticking out - we didn't get any sleep even though we were shattered. The bathroom was extremely pokey and there was a dodgy tube sticking out of the toilet so we were unable to use it. The air conditioning didn't work properly and was really noisy. We were next to a road so the room was far from quiet even though we were told all rooms were quiet. There was also a stain on the bed sheet. My Partner went down to complain the next morning and they said they would fix all the problems but he said we would like to change rooms - they were able to accommodate this for us but only had a ground floor room available. This room was much bigger but we overlooked the pool so had people on sunbeds directly outside our room so had to keep the curtains closed at all times. It was also very noisy in the evenings due to hotel entertainment so, again, being told that all rooms were quiet rooms was very far from the truth. We had to set our alarm at 07:30 every morning if we were to have any chance of getting sunbeds. You don't expect to have to do this on holiday. Food in the hotel was average - we only eat there twice, and had to complain as we went up to get our dessers and came back to find they had cleared the drinks from our tables! We had to kick up a huge fuss before they brought us some replacements - not what you expect from an alleged 4* hotel. We had a 4am flight home and the latest we were able to check out was 5pm which we found very shocking - we had to hang around from 5pm until 12.45 am which was when we were being collected to go to the airport and they also charged us 20 Turkish Lira per hour that we had the room - not very accommodating at all. However, there are some positives, the hotel is in a great location (even though the bar is open to the public), the pool is lovely and there are plenty of nice restaurants (Black Cat is definitely worth a try). We would recommend the Chill Out Cruise as this was exactly what it said it was and was adults only. We wouldn't recommend this hotel to family or friends but I am sure people will make their own minds up.
reviews.title: A few hiccups and in need of some work...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow - what a fab holiday we had at the Ambrosia! I cannot say anything bad about this hotel or resort!
reviews.title: Take me back to Bitez!

reviews.text: On first impressions, the hotel is modern and very clean. Check in was quick and simple and we were shown directly to our room. We were unsure of how to work the safe, within 2 minutes someone from reception helped us immediately. As mentioned in previous posts, the blanket for the bed was a little small, however I asked reception if we could have 2 blankets. This was fine, and the maid always ensured 2 were left each time the sheets were washed.
reviews.title: 2 weeks of heaven

reviews.text: The staff at Ambrosia are fantastic. Very helpful and friendly. A special mention goes to Cowboy, who works at the hotel's beach bar and as part of the entertainment team. He made our holiday extra special - lots of fun! We looked forward to seeing him each day. He really knows how to party!! :-)
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.text: The food was lovely. A wide variety is available for breakfast and the evening meal. The pancakes in the morning are delicious!! There are lots of restaurants along the sea front which serve lunch, however we ate lunch in the a la carte restaurant in the Ambrosia most days as it saved a walk in the heat!
reviews.title: Great Budget Holiday

reviews.text: returned to Ambrosia with friends having visited as a couple last year. The general ambience of the hotel remains friendly with helpful staff and of course that perfect beachfront position.
reviews.title: 2nd visit worthwhile

reviews.text: The shabby areas noticed last year such as broken decking near the breakfast area have been redone. New cushion on all loungers pool and beach are very comfortable but the new beach towels are awful! Actually large tea towels which to not offer any absorbency at all and take forever to dry out.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel ,great location, 5 star beach service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food has improved enormously. Breakfast much the same with egg station and usual hot and cold buffet. Dinner however is much better than last year and we chose to eat in as part of our half board deal on 5 evenings.
reviews.title: Nice beach, food cheap and basic

reviews.text: The a la carte remains good with excellent staff and of course Richard Gere.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great location-unfortunately it is let down by quality of food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One huge complaint as mentioned in other reviews was the VERY loud music from Shamrock bar, playing music only suitable for clubs in Ibiza. However after speaking to the Thomson rep who in turn spoke to Joy, manager, this was resolved with more appropriate music genre at an acceptable volume.
reviews.title: Great hotel

General Features: Half board, Worldwide Kitchen, indoor/outdoor restaurants, Ala carte restaurant, Lobby Bar, Pool Bar and Beach Bar. Outdoor Swimming Pool, Outdoor Children’s Swimming Pool, Entertainment, Children’s Play Area, Gym, SPA, Laundry/Dry Cleaning, Currency Exchange, Baggage Room, Doctor. Meeting Rooms: 450 person Meeting Room, 350 person Ballroom, 60 person Workshop, and 14 person VIP Business Meeting Room. All are equipped with the necessary equipment and services.
